title: hyperlink element
description: If the a element has an href attribute, then it represents a hyperlink (a hypertext anchor) labeled by its contents.

references.title: HTML5 spec for the a element

assertions.title: convey the link role
assertions.rationale: The user needs to know that the element is a link.
examples: A screen reader might announce a link as something like "<name>, link"
Voice control software might let a user say something like "click link"

assertions.title: convey the name of the link
assertions.rationale: The user needs to know where the link will take them.
examples: A screen reader might announce a link as something like "<name>, link"
Voice control software might let a user say something like "click <name>"

assertions.title: convey the boundaries of the link
assertions.rationale: The user needs to know where the link will take them.
examples: A screen reader might announce an inline link as something like "<name>, link"
A screen reader might announce when it enter and exits a links the spans multiple lines.
A screen reader might announce the link role for every line that the links spans

assertions.title: provide shortcuts to jump to links
assertions.rationale: A user might want to skim the page for links

assertions.title: convey the visited state
assertions.rationale: A user might want to know that they have already visted the link
